member.name: MIB_IPSTATS
member.summary: TheMIB_IPSTATS structure stores information about the IP protocol running on a particular computer.

summary.para: Specifies whether IP forwarding is enabled or disabled for a protocol (IPv4 or IPv6).

On Windows Vista and later, this member is defined as a union containing a DWORD dwForwarding member and a MIB_IPSTATS_FORWARDING Forwarding member where MIB_IPSTATS_FORWARDING is an enumeration defined in the Ipmib.h header file.
summary.div: Note This member applies to the entire system per protocol (IPv4 or IPv6) and doesn’t return per interface configuration for IP forwarding.

listheader.description: Use the current IP forwarding setting. This value is only applicable when setting the forwarding and time-to-live (TTL) options using the SetIpStatistics and functions.

summary.para: The default initial time-to-live (TTL) for datagrams originating on a particular computer.
This member can be set to MIB_USE_CURRENT_TTL to use the current default TTL value when setting the forwarding and time-to-live (TTL) options using the SetIpStatistics and functions.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwInReceives
member.summary: The number of datagrams received.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwInHdrErrors
member.summary: The number of datagrams received that have header errors.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwInAddrErrors
member.summary: The number of datagrams received that have address errors.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwForwDatagrams
member.summary: The number of datagrams forwarded.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwInUnknownProtos
member.summary: The number of datagrams received that have an unknown protocol.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwInDiscards
member.summary: The number of received datagrams discarded.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwInDelivers
member.summary: The number of received datagrams delivered.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwOutRequests
member.summary: The number of outgoing datagrams that IP is requested to transmit. This number does not include forwarded datagrams.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwRoutingDiscards
member.summary: The number of outgoing datagrams discarded.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwOutDiscards
member.summary: The number of transmitted datagrams discarded.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwOutNoRoutes
member.summary: The number of datagrams for which this computer did not have a route to the destination IP address. These datagrams were discarded.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwReasmTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time allowed for all pieces of a fragmented datagram to arrive. If all pieces do not arrive within this time, the datagram is discarded.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwReasmReqds
member.summary: The number of datagrams that require re-assembly.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwReasmOks
member.summary: The number of datagrams that were successfully reassembled.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwReasmFails
member.summary: The number of datagrams that cannot be reassembled.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwFragOks
member.summary: The number of datagrams that were fragmented successfully.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwFragFails
member.summary: The number of datagrams that have not been fragmented because the IP header specifies no fragmentation. These datagrams are discarded.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwFragCreates
member.summary: The number of fragments created.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwNumIf
member.summary: The number of interfaces.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwNumAddr
member.summary: The number of IP addresses associated with this computer.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS.dwNumRoutes
member.summary: The number of routes in the IP routing table.

member.name: MIB_IPSTATS
member.summary: TheMIB_IPSTATS structure stores information about the IP protocol running on a particular computer.

summary.para: Specifies whether IP forwarding is enabled or disabled for a protocol (IPv4 or IPv6).

On Windows Vista and later, this member is defined as a union containing a DWORD dwForwarding member and a MIB_IPSTATS_FORWARDING Forwarding member where MIB_IPSTATS_FORWARDING is an enumeration defined in the Ipmib.h header file.
summary.div: Note This member applies to the entire system per protocol (IPv4 or IPv6) and doesn’t return per interface configuration for IP forwarding.

listheader.description: Use the current IP forwarding setting. This value is only applicable when setting the forwarding and time-to-live (TTL) options using the SetIpStatistics and functions.

summary.para: The default initial time-to-live (TTL) for datagrams originating on a particular computer.
This member can be set to MIB_USE_CURRENT_TTL to use the current default TTL value when setting the forwarding and time-to-live (TTL) options using the SetIpStatistics and functions.
